titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lester W. Clark Kings County Supreme Court case notes 1973.303
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-09T10:08-0500

did.unittitle: Lester W. Clark Kings County Supreme Court case notes

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Lester W. Clark (1854-1922) was elected as a Republican to the Kings County Supreme Court from 1907 to 1920. He was a resident of Staten Island.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Court case notes of the Honorable Lester W. Clark, Justice of the Kings County Supreme Court. The notes are handwritten, housed in a single hardbound volume, and span the period 1924 to 1925. The notes provide synopses of cases heard during this period, the names of plaintiffs and defendents involved, and the judgement for each case. The vast majority of the cases documented are civil cases.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Lester W. Clark Kings County Supreme Court case notes, 1973.303, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
